com.soa.agent

Class Attachment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.agent.Attachment

  • public class Attachment
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds an attachment to be delivered through application and classloader boundaries. As such, it must only container data members that are of types found in the Java JRE.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Attachment()
      Default constructor
      Attachment(java.lang.String contentID, java.lang.String contentType, java.io.InputStream content)
      Constructs with an ID, content-type, and content.

      • addHeaderValue

        public void addHeaderValue(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String value)
        Adds a header to the attachment. If this method is called multiple times with the same header name, the values will be added creating a multi-valued header.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the header.
        value - Value of the header.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String value)
        Replaces the current header with the same name with the given value. If the header is not present, it will be added.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the header.
        value - Value of the header.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String[] values)
        Replaces the current header with the same name with the given values. If the header is not present, it will be added.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the header.
        value - String[] of header values.

      • getHeaderValue

        public java.lang.String[] getHeaderValue(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value(s) of the header with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the header.
        Returns:
        String[] holding the values of the header. If the header is not present null will be returned.

      • getHeaderNames

        public java.util.Set getHeaderNames()
        Returns the names of all headers defined for the attachment.
        Returns:
        Set of header names. The Set is mutable. Any changes, such as deletions, will be reflected in the attachment.
